recipesJson.name: The Frenchie
recipesJson.author: SlashaLO
recipesJson.description:
So, I got in the mood fairly recently for a savory vape, nothing too sweet. It's odd, I know. I love the taste of WF Croissant so I decided to take it and see where it went. This is a fresh baked Croissant with a little complexity of almond and honey. 

WF Croissant: This is the base of course. This is a great Croissant, that's all there is to it. You get a slightly dry, flaky pastry of this. I get a slight toasted note to it as well. 

TPA Butter: What is a croissant without folds and folds of butter in the dough. This also adds a hint of moisture to the croissant, keep it less dry. 

FA Almond: The nuttiness plays very well with the dough. Its nots sweet, adds to the savoriness of the vape while adding a hint of complexity.

FA Honey: Adds a HINT of of an inclination of sweetness. This is more of a light glazed, layered on just as the croissant leaves the oven. 

JF Biscuit: Added this down the road, I wanted to add more texture to the croissant, as well as add a tad more butter as well.

reviews.text:
A really nice and subtle vape this is, not quite like a real croissant yet though, it lacks a bit of the toasty flakiness in my opinion. I suggest you try adding about 0.25% of Breakfast (SA). I did also add 0.1% Super Sweet (PUR) for the glazing to reach its full potential for my taste buds. 
Chapeau to you SlashaLO, this is not an easy profile to pursue.
